title: Antiquarian 'invented' inscription, dedication by Gorgon
support: A smooth cylindrical column, with a moulding around the top and a small cavity (2cm diam) in the upper surface.

layout.p: Text in Greek letters over five lines, over the lower two thirds of the vertical side of the column

date._: An 18th century invention, probably between 1769 (publication of Torremuzza's corpus which provides the inspiration) and 1784 (first report by Biscari)

provenanceFound._: Biscari (1784) states that it was found at Messina among the ruins of the earthquake in 1783

provenanceObserved._: subsequent accounts in the early C19 attribute it to Capo Peloro (in Korhonen's view, a later refinement/attribution by Biscari)

graphics.desc: I.Sicily with the permission of the Assessorato Regionale dei Beni Culturali e dell’Identità Siciliana - Dipartimento dei Beni Culturali e dell’Identità Siciliana

location.address: Castello Ursino, Piazza Federico II di Svevia, 95121 Catania (CT)
